refifer package¶

Submodules¶

refifer.client module¶

Module used for connecting with the fetchr’s notification service. This module uses the request library extensively and the responses are usually requests.Response objects

class refifer.client.Refifer(access_token, retry_count=10, timeout=None, proxies=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Client used for making api calls to fetchr’s notification service and also for registering and pushing events.

Parameters:

access_token (str) – the access_token that was gotten from the authentication service.
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • retry_count (int) – the number of times a request will be retried on error.
  • timeout (int) – the number of seconds the request should wait before timing-out the request.
  • proxies (dict) – proxy configurations as used by the request lib
client_registration_data(event_name, client_id)[source]¶

Gets the events notification registration details for the client who owns the client_id used in instantiating this class.

Parameters:
  • event_name (str) – the name of the event whose registration details is to be gotten from the server.
  • client_id (str) – the client_id of the client
Returns:

the registration data that was used in registering the event with the given name for the client.
Return type:

dict

Note

this method is NOT currently supported at the service.

fire(event_name, payload={}, client_id=None, transaction_ref=None)[source]¶

Publishes an event but builds an event object for you. You have to provide the necessary parameters used in building the event object.

Parameters:

event_name (str) – the name of the event
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • payload (dict) – the payload for the events being fired
  • client_id (str) – the client_id of the client
  • transaction_ref (str) – the transaction reference for the event
Returns:

response gotten from firing event
Return type:

requests.Response
fire_event(event)[source]¶

Publishes an event object to the server. The event object includes the payload that should be broadcasted to the registed endpoints for the event.

Parameters:event (Event) – the event that should be fired
Returns:response gotten from firing event
Return type:requests.Response
register(registration_payload, client_id)[source]¶

Makes an event registration request with a raw payload

Parameters:
  • registration_payload (dict) – a json serializable dict containing the raw payload that will be submitted to the regostration endpoint
  • client_id (str) – the client_id of the client
Returns:

the Response object which is the result of registering an event.
Return type:

requests.Response
register_event(event_registration)[source]¶

Registers an event with the server and provides a list of endpoints that are to broadcasted to when the event is fired.

Parameters:event_regisration (EventRegistration) – the object that encapsulates the registration of an event.
Returns:the Response object which is the result of registering an event.
Return type:requests.Response
request(endpoint, args=None, post_args=None, method=None, client_id=None)[source]¶

Makes a request to the notifications api and returns the response. if post_args are available, it makes a post request to the server.

Parameters:

endpoint (str) – the url endpoint to make the request on
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • args (dict) – url parameters structured as a dict
  • post_args (dict) – data to be submitted to the server as form data
  • method (str) – http method that will be used for the request
  • client_id (str) – the client_id for the client making the request
Returns:

a Response object that was the result of the call to the server.
Return type:

requests.Response
unsubscribe_client(client_id)[source]¶

Unsubscribes the client from events notifications.

Parameters:client_id (str) – the client_id of the client
Returns:response gotten from unsubscribing
Return type:requests.Response

refifer.constants module¶

refifer.events module¶

Module which contains classes and other functionalities for handling events

class refifer.events.Event(name, payload={}, client_id=None, transaction_ref=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents an event that will be sent to the notification service. This class uses validators to validate the payload of its instances.

Validators are callables which takes an event as input and raises an exception if the payload could not be validated by the callable.

add_payload_validator(validator)[source]¶
clear_validators()[source]¶
get_data()[source]¶
validate()[source]¶
class refifer.events.EventRegistration(registration_payload={}, client_id=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class that represents the data used for registering events notification on the service.

The registration payload can be set by users but the payload can also be build by adding events to the registration object using the exposed methods.

Keyword Arguments:
 
  • registration_payload (dict) – an optional keyword arguement that contains the payload that will be posted to the server.
  • client_id (str) – the id of the client the event is being registered for
event_registration_data()[source]¶

Prepares the data that will be posted to the notification service given the event codes that have been added to the instance.

set_registration_info(event_name, urls=None, emails=None, sms_numbers=None)[source]¶

Adds an event to the list of events that are to be registered, including the url, email, or sms number that are to recieve notifications about the event for a given client.

Parameters:

event_name (str) – the code that uniquely identifies the event.
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • urls (list) – (optional) a list of url for the endpoint that will recieve the event.
  • emails (list) – (optional) a list of email that will be sent a notification hen the event is fired.
  • phone_numbers (list) – (optional) a list of phone number that will be sent a notification when the event is fired.
refifer.events.picked_event_validator(event)[source]¶

validator used for validating the fields of a picked event

Parameters:event (Event) – the event that is to be validated.

refifer.exceptions module¶

Exception Module which contains the exceptions that will be raised when certain problems occur in the library.

exception refifer.exceptions.AuthorizationError[source]¶

Bases: refifer.exceptions.RefiferError

Exception raised when the client could not be authenticated on the server.

exception refifer.exceptions.ClientNotRegisteredError[source]¶

Bases: refifer.exceptions.RefiferError

Exception to be raise when the client has not registered for notifications on the server

exception refifer.exceptions.DuplicateEventError[source]¶

Bases: refifer.exceptions.RefiferError

Raised when a duplicate event has been disallowed by the server.

exception refifer.exceptions.RefiferError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Base exception class which all Exceptions in this library should inherit from.

exception refifer.exceptions.ValidationError[source]¶

Bases: refifer.exceptions.RefiferError

Exception raised when the payload of an event fails to pass some validation

exception refifer.exceptions.ValueError[source]¶

Bases: refifer.exceptions.RefiferError

Raised in place of the default ValueError.
